natural solution: Let $P$ be the point on the unit circle that is $240^\circ$ counterclockwise from $(1,0)$, and let $D$ be the foot of the altitude from $P$ to the $x$-axis, as shown below. [asy] pair A,C,P,O,D; draw((0,-1.2)--(0,1.2),p=black+1.2bp,Arrows(0.15cm));

draw((-1.2,0)--(1.2,0),p=black+1.2bp,Arrows(0.15cm)); A = (1,0); O= (0,0); label("$x$",(1.2,0),SE); label("$y$",(0,1.2),NE); P = rotate(240)*A; D = foot(P,A,-A); draw(O--P--D); draw(rightanglemark(O,D,P,2));
draw(Circle(O,1)); label("$O$",O,SE); label("$P$",P,SW); //label("$A$",A,SE); label("$D$",D,N); [/asy] Triangle $POD$ is a 30-60-90 triangle, so $DO = \frac{1}{2}$ and $PD = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}$.
Therefore, the coordinates of $P$ are $\left(-\frac12,-\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}\right)$, so $\sin240^\circ = \boxed{-\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}}$.
